intro: Crassothonna cacalioides, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has a robust, upright stem with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Crassothonna cacalioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
